# INAppendToNoteIntentResponse

**Class**

Your app’s response to a request to append content to a note.

## Declaration

```swift
class INAppendToNoteIntentResponse
```

## Overview

Use an [doc://com.apple.sirikit/documentation/Intents/INAppendToNoteIntentResponse] object to return information about the updated note. Siri communicates the information from the response to the user at appropriate times. Be sure to include the details of the note in the [doc://com.apple.sirikit/documentation/Intents/INAppendToNoteIntentResponse/note] property.

You create an [doc://com.apple.sirikit/documentation/Intents/INAppendToNoteIntentResponse] object in the [doc://com.apple.sirikit/documentation/Intents/INAppendToNoteIntentHandling/confirm(intent:completion:)] and [doc://com.apple.sirikit/documentation/Intents/INAppendToNoteIntentHandling/handle(intent:completion:)] methods of your handler object. For more information about implementing your handler object, see [doc://com.apple.sirikit/documentation/Intents/INAppendToNoteIntentHandling].

## Initializing the Response Object

- **init(code:userActivity:)**: Initializes the response object with the specified code and user activity object.

## Getting the Response Code

- **code**: The code indicating whether you successfully handled the intent.
- **INAppendToNoteIntentResponseCode**: Constants indicating the state of the response.

## Accessing the Note Content

- **note**: The details of the note that you updated.

## Note Additions

- **INAppendToNoteIntentHandling**: The handler interface for appending content to a note.
- **INAppendToNoteIntent**: A request to append content to a note.

## Inherits From

- INIntentResponse

## Conforms To

- CVarArg
- CustomDebugStringConvertible
- CustomStringConvertible
- Equatable
- Hashable
- NSCoding
- NSCopying
- NSObjectProtocol
- NSSecureCoding
